intro: Melo agrestis, commonly known as the wild persimmon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly in regions with acidic soils. The plant produces small, orange berries that are edible but often have astringent properties. Its leaves are elliptical and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are white and fragrant. Melo agrestis is often found in woodland habitats and thrives in partial shade.
